job description:
Based in our Lafayette site in Colorado, we have a great opportunity for a Scientist position in the Biology R&D team focusing on research and development of new research tools, including gene editing and gene modulation products. In this role you will have primary responsibility for maintaining and fulfilling cell culture support for the R&D group. You will also work with other team members on several projects towards development of innovative solutions and additions to the Horizon Discovery product portfolio.

Key Responsibilities
  • Manage cell culture lab, including maintenance of multiple cell lines, cell counting, cell plating, and generating stable cell lines
  • Design, execute and complete tasks following a Research/Development Plan
  • Analyze and document data to draw meaningful conclusions and troubleshoot effectively
  • Contribute ideas and solutions that improve current processes
  • Comply with Company's quality management system.
Qualifications/Requirements
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, Biology, Biochemistry or related field
  • Two to five years of relevant technical experience in the following:
  • Cell culture work and experience with multiple cell lines
  • Molecular biology (e.g., nucleic acid purification, RT-PCR/qPCR)
  • Microbiology (e.g., bacterial culturing, cloning, bacterial transformations)
Successful candidates should be comfortable working in a fast-paced, team environment and on multiple projects with constantly changing priorities and deadlines, be well organized, self-motivated and have excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
